meta_description.title: Missile Command - Wikipedia
meta_description.text: Missile Command is a 1980 shoot 'em up arcade video game developed and published by Atari, Inc. and licensed to Sega for Japanese and European releases.Mode(s): Up to 2 players, alternating turnsPublisher(s): Arcade: ‎NA‎: Atari Inc. JP/‎EU‎: ‎Sega‎; ...‎Programmer(s): Rich Adam; Dave Theurer‎Composer(s): Rich Adam‎Development · ‎Ports · ‎Reception · ‎Legacy

people_also_ask.heading: Missile Command® Protect your cities from attack by moving a crosshair into the incoming missiles' path to destroy the enemy's weapons. Tip: Click your cursor – or tap on your mobile screen - on the spot you want the bomb to explode. Place below the missile's path to net the best success.

knowledge_panel.description: missile command is a 1980 shoot 'em up arcade video game developed and published by atari, inc. and licensed to sega for japanese and european releases. it was designed by dave theurer, who also designed atari's vector graphics game tempest from the same year. wikipedia
